intro: Scaevola grandiflora, commonly known as the海滨风铃花 or coastal windbell, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Australia. It is a low-growing shrub that produces clusters of small, bright pink or white flowers that resemble wind chimes. The plant has silver-gray foliage and is well adapted to salty sea air and sandy soils. It is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value. Scaevola grandiflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
